content.raw:
This is really strange. If I work with you file, I get the following output:


```
#!bash

/tmp/manifold/example/build$ ./rndf_info ../../test/rndf/sample1.rndf 
Name:               [Sample_RNDF_Rev_1.5]
Version:            [1.0]
Creation date:      [29-Mar-07]
Number of segments: 13
Number of zones:    1

```

But if I call it with my file:


```
#!bash

./rndf_info darpa.rndf 
[Line 329]: Unable to parse segment header element
 "segment_name  Nebraska_St     /*parking lot entrance road*/   "
File [darpa.rndf] is invalid

```

(I've copied it to the current build directory)

I've also made a diff between files and I think that its a matter of regular expressions because of spaces and tabs. [Here](https://gist.github.com/agalbachicar/b5b11044766e94ba9efd5892b7b34667) is the link of the output of the diff.

/tmp/manifold/example/build$ ./rndf_info ../../test/rndf/sample1.rndf 
Name:               [Sample_RNDF_Rev_1.5]
Version:            [1.0]
Creation date:      [29-Mar-07]
Number of segments: 13
Number of zones:    1

But if I call it with my file:

./rndf_info darpa.rndf 
[Line 329]: Unable to parse segment header element
 "segment_name  Nebraska_St     /*parking lot entrance road*/   "
File [darpa.rndf] is invalid

(I've copied it to the current build directory)

I've also made a diff between files and I think that its a matter of regular expressions because of spaces and tabs. Here is the link of the output of the diff.
